definition: toward or in a lower physical position, to a lying or sitting position, toward or to the ground, floor, or bottom
as a down payment
on paper
in a direction that is the opposite of up: such as
southward
to or toward a point away from the speaker or the speaker's point of reference
examples: walked down to my neighbor's house

definition: in or into the stomach
to a lesser degree, level, or rate
to or toward a lower position in a series
examples: seems to be far down on their agenda
moved down in the pop charts

definition: to or in a lower or worse condition or status
examples: held down by her lack of education

definition: used to indicate thoroughness or completion
examples: described him down to his haircut

definition: from a past time
examples: stories passed down by word of mouth

definition: to or in a state of less activity or prominence
to a concentrated state
examples: got the report down to three pages

definition: into defeat
perfectly, completely
examples: that suits me down to the ground

definition: down (see down entry 1) along, around, through, toward, in, into, or on
examples: grew up down the block from each other
pacing up and down the room

definition: to cause to go or come down (see down entry 1) : such as
to cause to fall by or as if by shooting : bring down sense 1
consume sense 3
to cause (a ball) to be out of play
examples: downed the ball at the five-yard line

definition: defeat
to go down
occupying a low position, lying on the ground, directed or going downward
lower in price
not being in play because of wholly stopped progress or because the officials stop the play
defeated or trailing an opponent (as in points scored)
out
examples: two down in the top of the third inning

definition: reduced or low in activity, frequency, or intensity
not operating or able to function
depressed, dejected, depressing
sick
done, finished
examples: eight down and two to go

definition: completely mastered
cool sense 7
understanding or supportive of something or someone
examples: trying to prove that they were down with hip-hop culture

definition: being on record
having a low opinion of or dislike for
examples: The coach has been down on him lately.

definition: experiencing misfortune and especially financial distress
descent, depression
examples: the ups and downs of the business cycle

definition: an instance of putting down someone (such as an opponent in wrestling)
a complete play to advance the ball
one of a series of four attempts in American football or three attempts in Canadian football to advance the ball 10 yards
examples: caught the ball on third down

definition: dislike, grudge
downer
a fundamental quark that has an electric charge of -¹/₃ and that is one of the constituents of a nucleon
an undulating usually treeless upland with sparse soil
examples: sheep grazing on the grassy downs

definition: a sheep of any breed originating in the downs of southern England
a covering of soft fluffy feathers, these feathers
something soft and fluffy like down
examples: a trace of down on his cheeks

definition: down syndrome
district of southeastern Northern Ireland bordering the Irish Sea; established 1974 area 250 square miles (650 square kilometers), population 69,750
traditional county of southeastern Northern Ireland
